name: 廖義田
objective:
The course is to provide a rigorous background in those chemical principles for analytical chemistry.A second goal is to understand the accuracy and precision of experimental data..Finally, a wide range of technique is introduced in  modern  analytical chemistry.
Classical  gravimetric , titrimetric analysis,  the theory of aqueous solution, activity, chemical
equilibrium, titration methods, potentiometry,, electrogravimetry, and voltammetry are elucidated.Finally, spectroscopy and chromatography are discussed.
schedule:
1-4 week, precision  and accuracy, gravimetric, titrimetric analysis,  the theory of chemical  equilibrium, and activity.
5-8 weeks, neutralization titration, precipitation titration, complex formation totration
9-12 weeks, electrochemistry, oxidation-reduction titration,,potentiometry
13-final, spectroscopy,IR,NMR, chromatography
